text: Drew Weissman (born September 7, 1959) is an American physician and immunologist. He is known for his contributions to RNA biology. Weissman's work helped create the mRNA vaccines, the best known of which are those for COVID-19 produced by BioNTech/Pfizer and Moderna. With biochemist Katalin Karik√≥, Weissman won the 2023 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine. ==References== Category:1959 births Category:Living people Category:American physicians Category:American immunologists Category:Scientists from Massachusetts
title: Drew Weissman
